feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 4:01PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Possible Across Eastern Interior Monday Into Tuesday... A mix of rain, snow and cooler temperatures is expected across the Eastern Interior from Monday into Tuesday. Rain and snow will develop Monday morning from Tok south, and then spread northwest to Denali, Fairbanks, and Ft Yukon by late Monday afternoon, and to the Brooks Range by Monday night. The rain and snow is expected
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 3:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..Snow Over Eastern North Slope Monday Night Through Tuesday Night... Between 2 and 4 inches of snow accumulation is possible between Monday night and Tuesday night from the Dalton Highway east. The heaviest amounts are expected east of the Dalton Highway.
